meanings.definition: A feast or party given by the family of a bride to the family of the groom after a wedding.
meanings.sent1: The infare was a joyful celebration with delicious food and lively music.
meanings.sent2: After the wedding, the infare brought both families together for a night of merriment.
meanings.sent3: At the infare, the bride's family surprised everyone with a funny dance performance.
meanings.sent4: The infare was a colorful tapestry of traditions and new beginnings.
meanings.sent5: The memories made at the infare would last a lifetime.

meanings.definition: The act of entering or going in.
meanings.sent1: The infare into the castle was grand and majestic.
meanings.sent2: She made a graceful infare into the room, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: With a dramatic infare, he announced his arrival with a flourish.
meanings.sent4: Her infare into the world of art was met with applause and admiration.
meanings.sent5: The infare of the new student into the school was met with curiosity and excitement.
